name: Leftover Pot Roast Casserole
author: Yoly
summary: I made a very large pot roast and gave some to my neighbor. The next day she shared this recipe that she made with it. It's absolutely delicious and a great idea to use up those leftovers.
ingredients: ½ pound baby carrots, cut into horizontal quarters
1 (4 ounce) package scalloped potatoes (such as Idahoan®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Melt 1/2 tablespoon butter in a skillet
Add carrots, onion, and celery; cook until tender, 5 to 8 minutes
Mix boiling water and 1 tablespoon butter in a bowl until butter is melted
Mix in milk, potatoes and the envelope of sauce mix from the box
Add pot roast mixture and stir until combined
Pour into the prepared baking dish
Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are fork-tender, 30 to 40 minutes
Remove from the oven and let sauce thicken for 5 minutes before serving
